New Records: Anthony Volpe became the ninth Yankee with a World Series grand slam and the sixth in postseason history.
Freddie Freeman entered having homered in each game of the series and wasted no time adding Game 4 to the list again, going yard in the first.
Key Match Events: Volpe added an eighth-inning double to spark a five-run frame, and had two stolen bases as well.
Freddie Freeman has now homered in six consecutive World Series games, dating back to 2021 with the Braves.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees made sure of that with an 11-4 victory in Game 4, forcing a Game 5.
